definition: lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience

sentences.english: Are you having guilty rectitude, or be afraid?
When you say that when someone coward In fact, I already know you have been a guilty conscience.
sentences.chinese: 当你说别人孬种的时候我已经知道其实你一直在心虚。

sentences.english: Given the fragile gas shortage, add dried longan meat porridge.
sentences.chinese: 心虚气不足，粥加桂圆肉。

sentences.english: But I am like that kid and have a guilty conscience generally.
sentences.chinese: 而我就像那个小孩一样，做贼心虚一般。

sentences.english: Belinda sat beside her, looking guilty.
sentences.chinese: 贝琳达坐在她身边，感到有点心虚。

sentences.english: You know how this is, men are guilty of it all the time.
sentences.chinese: 你知道是咋回事，男人们总是很心虚。

sentences.english: Ailey guilty, come home immediately took all the perfume.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉心虚，马上回家取走了全部的香水。

sentences.english: A guilty man apprehends danger in every sound.
sentences.chinese: 做贼心虚者听到听到任何声响都会觉得有危险。

sentences.english: Nor ashy pale the fear that false hearts have.
sentences.chinese: 也未让苍白透露出做贼心虚的惊恐。

sentences.english: Yi wan is very angry, the exhibition is also guilty, but really there is no other way.
sentences.chinese: 怡婉很生气，阿展也心虚，但是实在没有其他办法。

sentences.english: Bullies are usually insecure and Russia is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 但霸道者通常心虚，俄国也不例外。

sentences.english: Bay could only give a sheepish apology for the extra's misfortune.
sentences.chinese: 导演也只能为这个意外心虚地向他道歉。

sentences.english: Zeena sat beside her with a guilty look on her face.
sentences.chinese: 齐娜坐在她旁边，一副心虚的表情。

definition: to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to have secret motives/to have a guilty conscience
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
